general.red-minus-green: This function will calculate the difference in value between the blue and violet model results.

scenarios.selectedScenario-bar-and-line: LEFT BAR OR FULL LINE IN CHART
scenarios.selectedScenario2-bar-and-line: RIGHT BAR OR DASHED LINE IN CHART

tab3.welcome-2: Here you can see the fuel use for power and district heat production, power plant capacities and the electricity and district heating production divided on fuels.
tab3.welcome-3: The marginal electricity price and district heating price is the weighted average price of the time slices in the model over a year. These prices are endogenous calculated by the model and it is the prices which the model “trade” power and heat between sectors.
tab3.welcome-4: Try to select the CNN scenario and the NPH scenario and compare electricitydemand and the difference in needed power capacity.

tab-history.welcome-1: Welcome to Nordic Energy Statistics Database visualisations.
tab-history.welcome-2: The database aims for harmonising energy sector and related data across all the five Nordic countries. It will serve as a reference for research work as well as for the general public to see energy related data and selected progress indicators.
tab-history.welcome-3: The database will be published and maintained by Nordic Energy Research. Original sources of the data are mentioned in the metadata part for each data item.

tab-raw-history.welcome-1: Welcome to Nordic Energy Statistics Database Raw Historical Data

tab1.chart0: Primary Energy Supply by Energy Source
tab1.chart3: Final Energy Consumption by Energy Source
